content: A Paralyzed Man Healed
Getting into a boat,  crossed over  and came to His own city.
And they brought to Him a paralyzed man lying on a stretcher. And seeing their faith, Jesus said to the man who was paralyzed,
And some of the scribes said to themselves, “This man is blaspheming!”
And Jesus, perceiving their thoughts, said, —then He *said to the paralyzed man,
And he got up and went home.
But when the crowds saw , they were awestruck, and they glorified God, who had given such authority to men.
Matthew Called
As Jesus went on from there, He saw a man called Matthew sitting in the tax collector’s office; and He *said to him,  And he got up and followed Him.
Then it happened that as Jesus was reclining  in the house, behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and  dining with Jesus and His disciples.
And when the Pharisees saw , they said to His disciples, “Why is your Teacher eating with the tax collectors and sinners?”
But when  heard , He said,
The Question about Fasting
Then the disciples of John *came to Him, asking, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast, but Your disciples do not fast?”
And Jesus said to them,
Miracles of Healing

While He was saying these things to them, behold, a  official came and bowed down before Him, and said, “My daughter has just died; but come and lay Your hand on her, and she will become alive again.”
Jesus got up  and  accompany him, along with His disciples.
And behold, a woman who had been suffering from a hemorrhage for twelve years came up behind Him, and touched the border of His cloak;
for she was saying to herself, “If I only touch His cloak, I will get well.”
But Jesus, turning and seeing her, said,  And at once the woman was made well.
When Jesus came into the official’s house and saw the flute players and the crowd in noisy disorder,
He said,  And they  laughing at Him.
But when the crowd had been sent out, He entered and took her by the hand, and the girl got up.
And this news spread throughout that land.
As Jesus went on from there, two men who were blind followed Him, crying out, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”
And after He entered the house, the men who were blind came up to Him, and Jesus *said to them,  They *said to Him, “Yes, Lord.”
Then He touched their eyes, saying,
And their eyes were opened. And Jesus sternly warned them, saying,
But they went out and spread the news about Him throughout that land.
And as they were going out, behold, a demon-possessed man who was unable to speak was brought to Him.
And after the demon was cast out, the man who was  unable to speak talked; and the crowds were amazed,  saying, “Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel.”
But the Pharisees were saying, “He casts out the demons by the ruler of the demons.”
Jesus was going through all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness.
Seeing the crowds, He felt compassion for them, because they were distressed and downcast, like sheep without a shepherd.
Then He *said to His disciples,
